body_html:
Well, readability has been improved, yes, but it is still not as good as the old style. Here are some issues:

  • The font for text in the new style is smaller than in the old style (and still thinner with less contrast), while the distance between lines is larger. Also, the grey boxes surrounding function names are now quite large, and vertical spacing in general is quite large. Furthermore, the menu bar is now shown on top at all times. The result is:
    • Harder to read text
    • Very spread out look
    • The old style fit about 50% more information on the screen at a time (less scrolling around)
  • The menu items on the sidebar no longer expand (are not nested). This used to be extremely helpful to quickly browse what is available. I see that there is now a new sidebar on the right if you make the window wide enough, which shows fully expanded contents, but this is not very useful.
    • while you are at it, it would be nice to have the left side-bar not scroll with the main content

body:
Well, readability has been improved, yes, but it is still not as good as the old style. Here are some issues:
* The font for text in the new style is smaller than in the old style (and still thinner with less contrast), while the distance between lines is larger. Also, the grey boxes surrounding function names are now quite large, and vertical spacing in general is quite large. Furthermore, the menu bar is now shown on top at all times. The result is:
    - Harder to read text
    - Very spread out look
    - The old style fit about 50% more information on the screen at a time (less scrolling around)
* The menu items on the sidebar no longer expand (are not nested). This used to be extremely helpful to quickly browse what is available. I see that there is now a new sidebar on the right if you make the window wide enough, which shows fully expanded contents, but this is not very useful.
    - while you are at it, it would be nice to have the left side-bar *not* scroll with the main content
